intro: Cliffortia juniperina var. brevifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cliffortia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in mountainous regions and has a compact, shrub-like growth habit. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers specific conditions to thrive.
